raw: Weatherwatch: thousands in lockdown rescue rainfall records .
replaced: Weatherwatch: thousands in lockdown rescue rainfall records .

raw: February 2020 was the wettest February on record for the UK and the fifth wettest of any calendar month in a series dating back to 1862 .
replaced: February 2020 was the wettest February on record for the UK and the fifth wettest of any calendar month in a series dating back to 1862 .

raw: 209 mm of rain fell across the country , and some areas recorded as much as four times their normal February rainfall , resulting in severe flooding .
replaced: 209 mm of rain fell across the UK , and some areas recorded as much as four times some areas normal February rainfall , resulting in severe flooding .

raw: So how does this compare to the UK ’s wettest month on record : October 1903 ?
replaced: So how does this compare to the UK ’s wettest month on record : October 1903 ?

raw: The records show that 227 mm of rain fell during October 1903 , but the observations are not detailed enough to show precisely where and when the most intense rainfall occurred .
replaced: The records show that 227 mm of rain fell during October 1903 , but the observations are not detailed enough to show precisely where and when the most intense rainfall occurred .

raw: That ’s because thousands of meticulous weather observations are recorded in copperplate hand - writing , but have n’t yet made it to digital form .
replaced: That ’s because thousands of meticulous weather observations are recorded in copperplate hand - writing , but have n’t yet made copperplate hand - writing to digital form .
Now thousands of meticulous weather observations have !

raw: A call for volunteers to use Covid-19 lockdown time to help rescue rainfall records has resulted in over 15,000 people transcribing all five million UK rainfall measurements recorded between 1820 and 1960 , in the space of just three weeks .
replaced: A call for volunteers to use Covid-19 lockdown time to help rescue rainfall records has resulted in over 15,000 people transcribing all five million UK rainfall measurements recorded between 1820 and 1960 , in the space of just three weeks .

raw: Once the data has been double checked scientists will be able to compare exceptional months like October 1903 and February 2020 , and understand the variation in British weather .
replaced: Once the data has been double checked scientists will be able to compare exceptional months like October 1903 and February 2020 , and understand the variation in British weather .

raw: “ The next project will be at sea , looking at ship weather logbooks , ” says Ed Hawkins , who leads the Weather Rescue project .
replaced: “ The next project will be at sea , looking at ship weather logbooks , ” says Ed Hawkins , who leads the Weather Rescue project .
